quests: Prophesied against social injustice in Israel and Judah
Foretold the destruction of Samaria and Jerusalem
Proclaimed the Bethlehem prophecy of Messiah's birth
Announced the restoration of the remnant
Declared God's requirements: justice, mercy, humility
feats: Prophesied the exact birthplace of the Messiah - Bethlehem Ephrathah
Summarized true religion in one verse (Micah 6:8)
Predicted both judgment and messianic hope
name: Micah the Prophet | Jewish Heroes

primarySources.title: Book of Micah
primarySources.description: Oracles of judgment and hope for Israel and Judah

primarySources.title: Jeremiah 26:18-19
primarySources.description: Micah's prophecy remembered a century later

attributes.role: Minor Prophet (by book length, not importance)

bethlehemProphecy.hebrewText: וְאַתָּה בֵּית־לֶחֶם אֶפְרָתָה צָעִיר לִהְיוֹת בְּאַלְפֵי יְהוּדָה מִמְּךָ לִי יֵצֵא לִהְיוֹת מוֹשֵׁל בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וּמוֹצָאֹתָיו מִקֶּדֶם מִימֵי עוֹלָם
bethlehemProphecy.translation: But you, O Bethlehem Ephrathah, who are too little to be among the clans of Judah, from you shall come forth for me one who is to be ruler in Israel, whose coming forth is from of old, from ancient days (literally: from days of eternity).
significance: Emphasis on smallness - God chooses the insignificant
Eternal origins - 'from days of eternity' suggests pre-existence

matthewFulfillment.context: Chief priests and scribes cite Micah to Herod
matthewFulfillment.text: And you, O Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, are by no means least among the rulers of Judah; for from you shall come a ruler who will shepherd my people Israel.

johnReference.text: Has not the Scripture said that the Christ comes from the offspring of David, and comes from Bethlehem, the village where David was?

bethlehemRuler.theme: Birthplace and eternal origins of Messiah

shepherdKing.text: And he shall stand and shepherd his flock in the strength of the LORD, in the majesty of the name of the LORD his God.
shepherdKing.significance: Messianic shepherd - echoes David the shepherd-king

peaceBringer.text: And he shall be their peace.

famousVerse.hebrewText: הִגִּיד לְךָ אָדָם מַה־טּוֹב וּמָה־יְהוָה דּוֹרֵשׁ מִמְּךָ כִּי אִם־עֲשׂוֹת מִשְׁפָּט וְאַהֲבַת חֶסֶד וְהַצְנֵעַ לֶכֶת עִם־אֱלֹהֶיךָ
famousVerse.translation: He has told you, O man, what is good; and what does the LORD require of you but to do justice, and to love kindness (chesed), and to walk humbly with your God?
famousVerse.significance: Summary of prophetic ethics - justice, mercy, humility
corpusQueries: do justice love mercy walk humbly

philipPerspective.mosesAndProphets: Micah's Bethlehem prophecy confirms Jesus' messianic identity
nathanaelConnection: But Jesus was born in Bethlehem - fulfilling Micah 5:2
Both Bethlehem and Nazareth are 'insignificant' places
God chooses the small and despised
philipPerspective.propheticWitness: Micah joins Moses and Isaiah in testifying to the Messiah

jeremiahQuotation.context: Micah's prophecy saved Jeremiah from death
jeremiahQuotation.text: Micah of Moresheth prophesied in the days of Hezekiah... Did Hezekiah put him to death?

historicalImpact.hezekiahsReform: Micah's preaching contributed to Hezekiah's religious reforms

description: Micah (Mikhah) is the prophet of Bethlehem, whose precise prophecy of the Messiah's birthplace (Micah 5:2) was cited by the chief priests when Herod asked where the Christ would be born. A rural prophet addressing urban corruption, Micah summarized prophetic religion in the famous call to 'do justice, love mercy, and walk humbly with your God.'
